intro: Scaevola montana, commonly known as the mountain scaevola, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bilaterally symmetric flowers that are typically pink or purple. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom throughout the year in suitable conditions. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant colors and drought tolerance. Scaevola montana thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for coastal gardens.
